item.title: Timestomping
item.description: Timestomping is a technique that modifies the timestamps of a file (the modify, access, create, and change times), often to mimic files that are in the same folder and blend malicious ...

item.title: Unified Kill Chain
item.description: The unified kill chain aims to complement (not compete with) other cybersecurity kill chain frameworks, such as The Cyber Kill Chain. It states that there are 18 phases to an attack: Everything from reconnaissance to data exfiltration and understanding an attackerâ€™s motive.

item.title: Watering Hole
item.description: A watering hole attack is a targeted attack designed to aim at a specific group of people by compromising the website they are usually visiting and then redirecting them to the malicious ...

item.title: Wireshark
item.description: Tool used to analyze network traffic. The GOAT.

item.title: fuzzy hashing
item.description: Fuzzy hashing helps us to perform similarity analysis - match two files with minor differences based on the fuzzy hash values. One of the examples of fuzzy hashing is the usage of SSDeep.

item.title: Welcome to my Knowledgebase
item.description: Hey there! ðŸ‘‹ This is my personal knowledge base, where I document my journey, notes, and learnings in the world of cybersecurity. Here you can explore my write-ups, dive into networking concepts, or just learn alongside me.

item.title: URI, URN and URL
item.description: Web resources and web services such as RESTful APIs are identified using a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). A URI is a string of characters that identifies a specific network resource.

item.title: Backdoor
item.description: Maintaining access is important for adversaries, but it is very difficult. The longer a system has been compromised, greater are the risks of detection, and once detected the vulnerabilities will be patched and the cycle of pain continues.

item.title: C2
item.description: Command and Control (C2) Infrastructure are a set of programs used to communicate with a victim machine. This is comparable to a Reverse Shell, but is generally more advanced and often communicate via common network protocols, like HTTP, HTTPS and DNS.

item.title: Email Harvesting
item.description: Email harvesting is the process of obtaining email addresses from public, paid, or free services. A tool used for email harvesting is: theHarvester.
